tool.name: RUSLEAccScen
tool.displayname: Calculate soil loss accounts using two scenario folders

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool should be stored.

param.name: YearA_ScenarioFolder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder where the output from the Preprocess data tool is stored for the first year/scenario.

param.name: YearB_ScenarioFolder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder where the output from the Preprocess data tool is stored for the second year/scenario.

param.name: LS_option
param.expression: Calculate based on slope and length only | Include upslope contributing area
param.dialogReference:
This tool has two options to estimate the effect of slope length and steepness:

  • Calculate based on slope and length only: This method only accounts for slope length and steepness as specified by Morgan [1].

  • Include upslope contributing area: This method includes slope length, steepness, and upslope contributing area as specified by Moore and Burch [2]. This method may require more processing time if the study area is large or the DEM is high-resolution.

Default is Calculate based on slope and length only.

[1] Morgan, R. P. C. (2005) Soil Erosion and Conservation. National Soil Resources Institute, Cranfield University.

[2] Moore, I. D., & Burch, G. J. (1986). Physical Basis of the Length-slope Factor in the Universal Soil Loss Equation. Soil Science Society of America Journal, 50(5), 1294â€“1298.

param.name: LSfactor_cutoff_angle
param.dialogReference:
Specify the cutoff angle for calculating the LS-factor. Beyond this slope angle, only rock is expected to be found with no soil on the surface.The value of 26.6 degrees or 50% was suggested by [1].

[1] Panagos, P., Borelli, P., & Meusburger, K. (2015). A New European Slope Length and Steepness Factor (LS-factor) for Modeling Soil Erosion by Water. Geosciences. 5(2). 117-126.

param.name: Rainfall_erosivity_A
param.displayname: R-factor for Year A: Rainfall erosivity dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the rainfall erosivity raster for the first year/scenario.

param.name: Rainfall_erosivity_B
param.displayname: R-factor for Year B: Rainfall erosivity dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the rainfall erosivity raster for the second year/scenario.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset_A
param.displayname: P-factor for Year A: Support practice dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) raster for the first year/scenario.

param.name: Pfactor_dataset_B
param.displayname: P-factor for Year B: Support practice dataset
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename to the support practice (P-factor) raster for the second year/scenario.

tool.summary:
This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) approach for two different scenario folders. These scenario folders are generated by the Preprocess data tool which runs consistency checks and reconditions the DEM if required. This tool also takes in the rainfall erosivity and optional support factor datasets for two different years.

The outputs from this tool are the soil loss estimates for both years and the difference between these years.

idCitation.resTitle: Calculate soil loss accounts using two scenario folders

This tool estimates the annual soil loss (tonnes/ha/yr) using the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation (RUSLE) approach for two different scenario folders. These scenario folders are generated by the Preprocess data tool which runs consistency checks and reconditions the DEM if required. This tool also takes in the rainfall erosivity and optional support factor datasets for two different years.

The outputs from this tool are the soil loss estimates for both years and the difference between these years.
